member.name: M:Tapatalk.Handlers.TapatalkAPIHandler.login(Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject)
member.summary: Server returns cookies in HTTP header. Client should store the cookies and pass it back to server for all subsequence calls to maintain user session. ** DO NOT include HTTP Cookies in the request header **

body.parameter: The app should send the encrypted password to the server if there is instruction received from get_config. Otherwise send the plain-text password. For example most of the vBulletin systems requires md5 encryption by default, while SMF systems support SHA-1 encryption.
Allow user to login anonymously so the user does not appear in the Who's Online list. Useful for background login such as pulling unread PM etc.

member.name: M:Tapatalk.Handlers.TapatalkAPIHandler.get_config(Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject)
member.summary: This function is always the first function to invoke when the app attempts to enter a specific forum. It returns configuration name/value pair for this forum system. There are two kind of name/value pairs. One is those based on some of the forum system configuration, and one is a simple name/value pairs declared in the config.txt file, usually located in mobiquo/conf/config.txt. E.g. the "guest_okay" is based on the forum system configuration. while the "api_level" is mobiquo

member.name: M:Tapatalk.Handlers.TapatalkAPIHandler.get_forum(Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject)
member.summary: Return full forum in a nested tree structure. In API Level 3 no parameter required for this function and the sub-forum description. For Level 4, forum description is omitted unless "return_description" is set to true

body.parameter: request to return sub-forum description.
if this parmeter is presented, return only the immediate child of this forum.

member.name: M:Tapatalk.Handlers.TapatalkAPIHandler.get_participated_forum(Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject)
member.summary: return a list of sub-forum that user has previously participated in, order by the latest date of participation.

member.name: M:Tapatalk.Handlers.TapatalkAPIHandler.mark_all_as_read(Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject)
member.summary: mark all the unread topics as read

swagger.summary: mark all the unread topics as read

body.parameter: Specify the actual sub-forum to be marked as read, instead of marking the entire board as read. This parameters is only used when "mark_forum=1" returns in get_config, to indicate the plugin supports marking sub-forum read.

member.name: M:Tapatalk.Handlers.TapatalkAPIHandler.login_forum(Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject)
member.summary: Allows mobile client to access password protected sub-forum. It currently support only sub-forum at leaf level. If the password is valid, also return the updated cookies so the client will have access to the subsequent get_topic calls

swagger.summary: Allows mobile client to access password protected sub-forum

body.parameter: The forumId
The password

member.name: M:Tapatalk.Handlers.TapatalkAPIHandler.get_id_by_url(Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject)
member.summary: This new function is used to extract topic / post ID from a URL so an internal link can be open in app. Especially in SEO environment it is impossible for the app to detect the IDs from URL and hence requires server-side assistance. This function is used in conjunction with get_config that returns get_id_by_url = 1.

swagger.summary: extract topic / post ID from a URL

body.parameter: URL to be processed.

member.name: M:Tapatalk.Handlers.TapatalkAPIHandler.sign_in(Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject)
member.summary: Sign in with tapatalk id. When the account does not exist, register one first. Controlled by flag 'sign_in' returned in get_config.

body.parameter: login with tapatalk id will get the token
md5 of fid, tapatalk id join email of tapatalk id, sample: md5('123|1234|xxxx@gmail.com')
email of the account you'll be sign in. When you are sure the account already exists and want to sign in directly, provide email with token and code, don't need username and password
username of the account you'll be sign in. When you are sure the account already exists and want to sign in directly, provide username with token and code, don't need email and password
provide password if you want to register an account before sign in. In this case you need provide all five parameters.

md5 of fid, tapatalk id join email of tapatalk id, sample: md5('123|1234|xxxx@gmail.com')

New password to be udpated to.

md5 of fid, tapatalk id join email of tapatalk id, sample: md5('123|1234|xxxx@gmail.com')

member.summary: Return the maximum allowed attachments the user can be uploaded in a single post. If max_attachment is missing, it assumes the plugin does not support attachment upload. member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.search_topic_response.topic.short_content
member.summary: Characters display rules (should follow this sequence): 1) Remove all BBCode except [ur], [img]. 2) Convert "[url http://...]http://…..[/url]" to "[url]". 3) Convert "[img]http://…..[/img]" to "[img]". 4) Remove "Last edited by..." tag at the end. 5) Remove all non-displayable characters (e.g. \n, \t, etc). 6) Remove all whitespace, /n and /r at the beginning and ending of the content. 7) return only first 200 characters

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.unread_sticky_count
member.summary: Add a "unread_sticky_count" and "unread_announce_count" integer value in get_topic first level Hash-table to indicate users there are unread stickies topics and announcement in this sub-forum. This allow the app to show a unread badge when entering a sub-forum.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.unread_announce_count
member.summary: Add a "unread_sticky_count" and "unread_announce_count" integer value in get_topic first level Hash-table to indicate users there are unread stickies topics and announcement in this sub-forum. This allow the app to show a unread badge when entering a sub-forum.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.can_subscribe
member.summary: return true if current user can subscribe this forum. Default as true for member.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.is_subscribed
member.summary: return true if this forum was subscribed by current user

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.prefixes
member.summary: if this is not empty, it contains a list of prefixes, it indicates user need to enter prefix in order to create a new topic successfully

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topics
member.summary: Returns a list of topic in an array, each topic is in Hash Table format. Returns null if total_topic_num = 0

member.summary: return true if this thread has been closed.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.icon_url
member.summary: Return topic author avatar URL

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.last_reply_time
member.summary: dateTime.iso8601 format. If this topic has no reply, use the topic creation time.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.reply_number
member.summary: total number of reply in this topic. If this is no reply in this return, return 0.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.new_post
member.summary: return true if this topic contains new post since user last login

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.view_number
member.summary: total number of view in this topic

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.short_content
member.summary: Characters display rules (should follow this sequence): 1) Remove all BBCode except [ur], [img]. 2) Convert "[url http://...]http://…..[/url]" to "[url]". 3) Convert "[img]http://…..[/img]" to "[img]". 4) Remove "Last edited by..." tag at the end. 5) Remove all non-displayable characters (e.g. \n, \t, etc). 6) Remove all whitespace, /n and /r at the beginning and ending of the content. 7) return only first 200 characters

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.participated_uids
member.summary: Return a list of uids of the users who participated in this topic. It does not need to return all the uids of whoever participated, instead returns not more than 10, preferrably ordered by the "importance" - it can be determined by the number of posts the user contributed to this topic etc. Plugin should check HTTP Header "Mobiquoid". If it is ="11", return this key, otherwise do not return it.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.is_moved
member.summary: Indicate if this is a moved topic

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.is_merged
member.summary: Indicate if this is a topic merged into another topic

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.real_topic_id
member.summary: If this topic is a merged of moved topic, this key will include the real topic id

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.can_ban
member.summary: return true if the user has authority to ban the first or last post creator, depends on the function return from. E.g. get_unread_topic returns the last post, hence can_ban flag should indicate where the user has the authority to ban the last post creator.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.is_ban
member.summary: return true if the user has already been banned.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.can_delete
member.summary: return true if the user has authority to delete this topic.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.is_deleted
member.summary: return true if this topic has been soft-deleted.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.can_approve
member.summary: return true if the user has authority to approve this topic. This field is only returned with a topic is awaiting for moderation. If the topic does not need moderation or the topic has already been approved. Do not return this field.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_topic_response.topic.is_approved
member.summary: return false if this topic is not yet approved. If this key is missing, assume the thread is already approved. E.g. user login as admin will have the ability to see unapproved topic.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.version
member.summary: Tapatalk plugin version Plugin developers: Set "version=dev" in order to get your development environment verified by the Tapatalk Network.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.api_level
member.summary: This value is to advise the app the API Level of this mobiquo plugin is currently at. Tapatalk API is currently at Level 3 ("api_level=3"). If this name/value pair is missing, the app would fall back to legacy mode for compatibility purpose. We plan to break the existing API into multiple levels so developer does not need to implement ALL the documented API for faster prototyping and improve time-to-market in phased basis. For plugin developer, please always return this key so the app will not fall back to legacy mode which may invoke undocumented functions

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.is_open
member.summary: false: service is not available / true: service is available. Administrator can turn on/off by adjusting a value in a configuration file. If administrator set the entire forum system in maintenance mode, this should override this setting

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.guest_okay
member.summary: false: guest access is not allowed / true: guess access is allowed. Administrator can turn on/off by adjusting a value in the configuration file. If the forum system allows only login user, then the system value should over this setting

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.report_post
member.summary: Return true to indicate the plugin support report_post function.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.report_pm
member.summary: Return true to indicate the plugin support report_pm function.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.goto_post
member.summary: Please refer to get_thread_by_post for more details. Only use this flag if the plugin is only API Level 3 but want to enable this feature. This flag will no longer needed in API Level 4 4

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.goto_unread
member.summary: Please refer to get_thread_by_unread for more details. Only use this flag if the plugin is only API Level 3 but want to enable this feature. 4

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.mark_read
member.summary: It should returns "1" or "0". If this key is missing, always assume "1". This is to indicate if the forum system support function mark_all_as_read . E.g. bbPress do not have read/unread function hence missing this functionality.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.mark_forum
member.summary: It should returns "1" or "0". If this key is missing, always assume "0". This is to indicate if function mark_all_as_read can accept a parameter as forum id to mark a specified forum as read. Please refer to mark_all_as_read for more details. Only use this flag if the plugin is only API Level 3 but want to enable this feature. 4

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.no_refresh_on_post
member.summary: It should returns "1" or "0". If this key is missing, always assume "0". Please refer to reply_post and save_raw_post for more details. Only use this flag if the plugin is only API Level 3 but want to enable this feature. 4

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.disable_bbcode
member.summary: Return this as "0" do that the aplication render html content

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.subscribe_forum
member.summary: It should returns "1" or "0". If this key is missing, always assume "1". This is to indicate this forum system supports "Sub-Forum Subscription" feature. Please refer to get_subscribed_forum for more details

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.get_latest_topic
member.summary: It should returns "1" or "0". If this key is missing, always assume "0". This is to indicate this forum system does not support "get_latest_topic" function. Please refer to get_latest_topic for more details Please refer to get_latest_topic for more details 4

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.get_id_by_url
member.summary: It should returns "1" or "0". If this key is missing, always assume "0". This is to indicate this forum system does not support get_id_by_url function. Please refer to get_id_by_url for more details 4

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.delete_reason

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.m_approve

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.m_delete

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_config_response.m_report

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.reply_post_response.post_content
member.summary: Return the newly replied post content and all below keys back to the App if get_config return support no_refresh_on_post. Characters display rules (follow the sequence): 1) Remove all BBCode except [ur], [img], [quote]. 2) Remove all non-displayable characters (e.g. \n, \t, white-space, etc) at the beginning AND the end of the content (Trimming) 3) Replace [url] tags in nested [url][img][/img][/url] image link.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_thread_by_unread_response.position
member.summary: This value is to indicate the current first unread post position relative to the entire thread, starting from "1" to indicate first post, thereafter. For example if a thread contains 83 posts and "position" is "65", it means the first unread post is at the #65 post. The app can use this key, divided by "posts_per_request" to determine the "page number" the app should jump to, and then use this key to "%" posts_per_request to determine the exact postion of the first unread post within the page. For example, if position is "65", and posts_per_request is "20", the app should scroll to the page 3 and the 5th post automatically.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_thread_by_post_response.position
member.summary: This value is to indicate the target post position relative to the entire thread, starting from "1" to indicate first post, thereafter. For example if a thread contains 83 posts and "position" is "65", it means the target post is at the #65 post. The app can use this key, divided by "posts_per_request" to determine the "page number" the app should jump to, and then use this key to "%" posts_per_request to determine the exact postion of the target post within the page. For example, if position is "65", and posts_per_request is "20", the app should scroll to the page 3 and the 5th post automatically.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_box_response.message.short_content
member.summary: Characters display rules (should follow this sequence): 1) Remove all BBCode except [ur], [img]. 2) Convert "[url http://...]http://…..[/url]" to "[url]". 3) Convert "[img]http://…..[/img]" to "[img]". 4) Remove "Last edited by..." tag at the end. 5) Remove all non-displayable characters (e.g. \n, \t, etc). 6) Remove all whitespace, /n and /r at the beginning and ending of the content. 7) return only first 200 characters

member.name: M:TapatalkBase.Push.SendPush(System.String,System.String,System.String,TapatalkBase.Push.PushTypeEnum,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Send push notification to Tapatalk Push Server
member.param: tapatalk API key (used to identify forum, if push key was missing, forum url will be used to identify the forum)
id of user who will get the push notification, separate more than one user id with ','( nomally for 'sub' and 'newtopic' push notification)
push type, should be one of pm,sub,like,quote,newtopic,tag
topic id for sub,like,quote,newtopic,tag, private message id for 'pm'
post id for sub,like,quote,newtopic,tag, optional for 'pm'
username who trigger the push action
id of user who trigger the push action (optional)

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.login_response.max_attachment
member.summary: Return the maximum allowed attachments the user can be uploaded in a single post. If max_attachment is missing, it assumes the plugin does not support attachment upload. If a user is restricted from uploading attachment, it should use the "can_upload" flag in get_topic and get_thread to determine whether user can upload attachment, regardless how many attachments user can upload within a single post

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.login_response.max_attachment_size
member.summary: Return the maximum attachment file size in bytes the user can upload in a single message. If this flag was missing, check flag 'max_{ext}_size' for file with specific extension.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.login_response.max_png_size
member.summary: Return the maximum allowed PNG file size that the user can upload. This field is used in conjunction with the Attachment section. This number should be in byte.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.login_response.max_jpg_size
member.summary: Return the maximum allowed JPEG file size that the user can upload. This field is used in conjunction with the Attachment section. This number should be in byte.

member.summary: Characters display rules (should follow this sequence): 1) Remove all BBCode except [ur], [img]. 2) Convert "[url http://...]http://…..[/url]" to "[url]". 3) Convert "[img]http://…..[/img]" to "[img]". 4) Remove "Last edited by..." tag at the end. 5) Remove all non-displayable characters (e.g. \n, \t, etc). 6) Remove all whitespace, /n and /r at the begining and ending of the content. 7) return only first 200 characters

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_user_reply_post_response.can_ban
member.summary: return true if the user has authority to ban the post creator, depends on the function return from. E.g. get_unread_topic returns the last post, hence can_ban flag should indicate where the user has the authority to ban the last post creator.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_user_reply_post_response.is_ban
member.summary: return true if the user has already been banned.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_user_reply_post_response.can_delete
member.summary: return true if the user has authority to delete this post.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_user_reply_post_response.is_deleted
member.summary: return true if this post has been soft-deleted.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_user_reply_post_response.can_approve
member.summary: return true if the user has authority to approve this post. This field is only returned with a post is awaiting for moderation. If the topic does not need moderation or the post has already been approved. Do not return this field.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_user_reply_post_response.is_approved
member.summary: return false if this post is not yet approved. If this key is missing, assume the thread is already approved. E.g. user login as admin will have the ability to see unapproved topic.

member.name: F:Tapatalk_Plugin.Structures.get_user_reply_post_response.can_move
member.summary: return true if the user has authority to move this post to somewhere else.
